sub_title: Service Delivery Manager, Subsurface Data Integration
summary:
Information & Data Technology (IDT) contains Shell's IT operations powerhouse that provides end-to-end IT services for Shell E&P upstream & downstream customers globally through the delivery vertical of Upstream and in collaboration with Projects & Technology. Together with team of experienced Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) spread across globally, I champion Agile Operations in SAFe, Python automation, cloud native workflows and the progressive cloud transition for Subsurface Data Integration Apps and foundational data to the (O)SDU Data Platform on AWS. 

We have expertise in hosting infrastructure on Shell’s Global Data Centers and AWS Cloud with strong background knowledge of subsurface applications, security, monitoring, automation & database solutions like Oracle. Outstanding experience in monitoring systems for application and infrastructure services to ensure business service agreement is achieved for the AWS version of (O)SDU Data Lake (https://osduforum.org/about-us/who-we-are/)

As the Service Operations Manager I lead operations and help integrate both internal and external organizations including vendors/suppliers/customers and strengthen relationships by enabling collaboration of the right people at the right space. Experienced hiring manager by bringing in both Shell staff and contractors from a broad network of people globally.

certifications.name: Leadership Skill to Lead and Deliver (LEAD)
Stakeholder Management, Influencing and Communication Skills

profile_positions.description:
Subsurface IT Services provide support to geo-scientists, petroleum engineers, subsurface data managers and subsurface operations covering the full lifecycle of the Oil & Gas business. Shell’s Exploration & Production (E&P) data managers are currently using an extensive portfolio of Subsurface Applications to support the integrated management and delivery of corporate data for use in subsurface and Petro technical applications both in house solutions and vendor applications. 

The Data Integration Services team consists of professional staff operating in various locations with current main hub locations Rijswijk in the Netherlands and Houston in the United States, Bangalore and Poland. We manage the deployment, support and evergreen Shell’s cloud ecosystem with strong focus on Subsurface technology of Halliburton's Landmark Products but also Shell's in house developed technology. The Data Integration technology covers covering all Technical Data Management of wells bore data management, wells master manager, sub surface data universe based on the cloud & cloud native technologies through Terraform, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Docker, AWS etc. in the Open Subsurface Data Universe (OSDU) Data Lake. This workload includes managing, planning, architecting, and monitoring of cloud systems. Once the applications are deployed, day to day support of the applications lay in the hands of my global team of Site Reliability Engineers (SRE).
profile_positions.title: Service Delivery Lead Manager, Subsurface Data Integration (SDI)

profile_positions.description:
Supporting a Global footprint and managing an international team of engineers for the Geomatics landscape under Subsurface space to provide a secure, reliable and affordable IT service by robust delivery through delegation but ensuring responsibility and accountability are addressed. Provide maximum availability and reliability in IT service delivery to the business that is measurable in monthly service reviews to meet SLA key performance factors. Engage with vendors and Shell SSW portfolio to ensure that functionality bugs are appropriately addressed. On the job experience in moving IT services to the cloud both internally and externally, translating business workflows to IT solutions and integrating database management systems (Oracle) and web security in the landscape. Hands-on experience in monitoring systems for application and infrastructure services to ensure SLA’s are met. Deep understanding of system design and capacity planning to ensure that the applications and infrastructure services are adequately deployed, but also manage footprint properly to minimize loss. Adequate knowledge of ITIL processes, Agile operations and core Shell leadership skills.

EC Council - Certified Ethical Hacker
profile_positions.title: Operate Landscape Manager, GIS

profile_positions.description:
Involved in Enterprise Deployment and Operations of both GeoSigns (nDI) & GIS Services Landscapes. GeoSigns discipline covers the 3D seismic interpretations and basin play analysis. GIS services is related to mainly implementation of Esri platform on an Enterprise scale distributed in tens of locations worldwide and the integration of these deployments in a single Portal for ArcGIS. In this role I provide day to day operational excellence in two international teams as IT Operations Lead  

ESRI Enterprise Deployments and Migration 
Portal for ArcGIS, Enterprise Geodatabase (Oracle) and ArcGIS Server Administration/Deployments 
Python programming for HTTP/REST Administration 
Windows Administration/Management Instrumentation (WMI) 
Oracle/ArcSDE/Oracle Spatial Database Administration  
Security for GIS, Basics of Networks
ITIL practitioner

Soft skills
Influencing Skills
Communication Skills
Stakeholder Management
Problem Management with Kepner Tregoe
Financial Management
profile_positions.title: Service Delivery Lead, GeoSigns (nDI) & GIS

profile_positions.description: Progressing with large scale migration of GIS IT Systems in 2016 within Shell. Involved in Project Management and implementation for GIS, cloud implementation, Emergency Response Systems and Cloud migration.

Presently involved in various GIS/IT projects like GIS in Cloud Computing, ArcGIS for Server 10.2 migration, end to end secuity implementation on ArcGIS for Server using Kerberos, Shell and Python programming.
